notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Two uniform volumes containing detached protions of Maḥzor, provided with vowel-points and accents.

collation.p: Two quires of 8 and 6 leaves respectively.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script, punctuated and accentuated, of 14th century. Shelomoh bar Yeḥiʾel, inscibed with his name in volume two of this manuscript, Add MS 9406, folio 32v, with a date of Nisan 5069 (1309).

decoDesc.decoNote: 1rPen and ink figurative drawing at the beginning of each book.
3vPen and ink figurative drawing at the beginning of each book.
6rPen and ink figurative drawing at the beginning of each book.
12rPen and ink figurative drawing at the beginning of each book.
11vTwo independent full-page pen and ink drawings representing David and Goliath.

binding.p: Post-1600, tooled brown leather with clasps. Spine: 'Megilloth. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 9405.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Adam Clarke (b. 1762, d. 1832), Wesleyan Methodist minister and scholar: his bookplate with Greek inscription: ho theos agape estin (inner upper cover). This manuscript formed part of the collection of ten Hebrew manuscripts, together with Add MS 9398-9407, once property of the Hagen family and then bought for Adam Clarke at Utrecht in 1823, acquired by the British Museum in 1834.
